div.l: Vnto the cradulle And in his hande itt hente
And bare it soffte vnto his beddes Feete
Soone Affter the wyfe her Rowtenge lete
And gan to wake And wente her owte to pysse
And came agayne And gan her cradulle Mysse
And gropede here ⁊and there butte Sche Fonde noone
Alas qduod sche I hadde Allmoste mysse goone
I hadde Allmoste gone to the Clarkes bedde
Ey bn̄enedicite þan hadde I Fowle Spedde
And Forþe Sche gothe tille Sche the Cradulle Fonde
Sche gropeþe Allwaye Furþ̉ere with her hande
And Fonde þe bedde And þoughte notte butte goode
Bicause þat the Cradulle by hitt Stode
And nyste where Sche was For hitt was derke
Butte Fayer and well Sche crepte into þe clarke
And lyethe Fulle Stylle And wolde haue caughte A Slepe
Withynne A whyle this Iohn þe Clarke vppelepe
And on the gode wyfe he leyethe on Sore
So merye Affyte ne hadde Sche notte Fulle ȝore
He pryckeþe harde ⁊and deepe As he were Madde
This Iolye lyfe haue þese two Clarkes ladde
Tylle þat the þyrde Cocke bigaıı̄nne to Synge
Aleyn waxe werye in the Dawnenge
For he hadde Swonken All þe longe nyghte
And sayde Fare wele Malyn Swete wyghte
The daye is come I maye no lenger Abyde
Butte eủermore where So I go or or Aryde
I Am þyne owne Clarke So haue I hele
Now dere lem̄man qduod Sche go Fare wele
Butte ar þou go o thynge I wolle the telle
Whan þat þou wendeste homewarde by thy Mylle
Righte atte the entre of the durre bihynde
